children.message:
possible candidates are found in other modules, you can import them into scope:
  `use message::Message;`
  `use shared::Message;`
  `use shared::prelude::Message;`

message.message: cannot find type `Message` in this scope

text.text: fn handle_message(&mut self, message: Message, response: &mut Vec<ComponentResponse>) {

code.explanation:
An undeclared type or module was used.

Erroneous code example:

```compile_fail,E0433
let map = HashMap::new();
// error: failed to resolve. Use of undeclared type or module `HashMap`
```

Please verify you didn't misspell the type/module's name or that you didn't
forgot to import it:


```
use std::collections::HashMap; // HashMap has been imported.
let map: HashMap<u32, u32> = HashMap::new(); // So it can be used!
```
